result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna B Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by DOC.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Write minimum 250 word apology to victim.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Restitution has been paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anna B Olson in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Anna B Olson in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests 30 days, has offer from State, needs to discuss minor change to offer with ADA. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with Stone Harbor, GD.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Defendant Anna B Olson in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense enters not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
